title: How to Make Pie Crust with Vodka

steps.headline: Mix half of the shortening into the flour with a fork.
steps.description: Do this until it looks like cornmeal.

steps.headline: Add the second half of the shortening, until the mixture looks like small peas.
steps.description: Not all of the flour will be touching the shortening; don't worry, this is good.

steps.headline: Add 3 tablespoons of water to the mix, one tablespoon at a time.
Once it is mixed well, add the same amount of vodka.
Roll the crust out onto the table on a well floured surface.
Roll out the dough, making sure to keep the surface floured, and flipping the dough over onto a re-rolled surface every few rolls to keep it from sticking.
Fold the dough into fourths, so that it will transfer into the pie crust without breaking.

text: Mix half of the shortening into the flour with a fork. Do this until it looks like cornmeal. Add the second half of the shortening, until the mixture looks like small peas. Not all of the flour will be touching the shortening; don't worry, this is good. Add 3 tablespoons of water to the mix, one tablespoon at a time.  Once it is mixed well, add the same amount of vodka.  Roll the crust out onto the table on a well floured surface.  Flour the rolling pin.  Roll out the dough, making sure to keep the surface floured, and flipping the dough over onto a re-rolled surface every few rolls to keep it from sticking.  Fold the dough into fourths, so that it will transfer into the pie crust without breaking.  Finished.
